Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of friends, family, and girlfriends of the 9/11 terrorists who were sent back to Saudi Arabia.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the friends, family, and girlfriends of the 9/11 terrorists were sent back to Saudi Arabia.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the friends, family, and girlfriends of the 9/11 terrorists knew about the terrorist plot and wanted to watch it on television, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the friends, family, and girlfriends of the 9/11 terrorists may have left the United States before the attacks.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the findings of the 9/11 Commission report, which states that none of the hijackers had a wife, girlfriend, or family member in the country in the days and months before the attacks.
